sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Cream Mixer for homogeneous mixing of pharmaceutical creams, ointments, and semi-solid topical preparations.
sections.scope: Applicable to cream and ointment preparation activities carried out in the Pharmaceutics.
procedure: Ensure the cream mixer is installed on a stable surface in a clean area.
Verify that the mixing vessel, blades, and lid are clean and sanitized.
Check that all electrical connections are secure and grounded.
Weigh all ingredients accurately as per the formulation.
Add the base ingredients (oils, waxes, emulsifiers) into the mixing vessel.
If required, heat the vessel using water bath or heating jacket to melt ingredients.
Power ON the cream mixer and set to low speed initially.
Allow the base ingredients to melt and mix uniformly.
Add aqueous phase slowly if preparing emulsion-based cream.
Gradually increase mixing speed to achieve proper emulsification.
Scrape down the sides of the vessel periodically to ensure uniform mixing.
Add active pharmaceutical ingredients at appropriate temperature.
Continue mixing until a smooth, homogeneous cream is formed.
Check for lumps, graininess, or phase separation.
Adjust mixing speed and time based on cream consistency.
Allow the cream to cool if heated, while continuing gentle mixing.
Once desired consistency is achieved, stop the mixer.
Transfer the cream to appropriate containers for filling or storage.
Clean the mixing vessel, blades, and accessories immediately after use.
Perform cleaning validation if required for product changeover.
Document mixing parameters, batch details, and quality observations in the record.
precautions: Do not exceed maximum vessel capacity to prevent spillage.
Maintain proper temperature control to prevent ingredient degradation.
Avoid excessive mixing speed that can incorporate air bubbles.
Ensure proper emulsification to prevent phase separation.
Add ingredients in correct order as per formulation requirements.
Check mixer blades for proper alignment and no damage.
Wear appropriate PPE including gloves and lab coat.
Handle heated materials with caution to prevent burns.
Clean thoroughly between different products to prevent contamination.
Inspect final product for uniformity and absence of grittiness.
